column1: Good luck to the @Patriots as they take on the @Titans. #GoPats #EarnedNotGiven
Wishing you all a happy and prosperous New Year!
Happy New Year's Eve!
Merry Christmas to all!
#Hanukkah sameach to all who are celebrating. Have a wonderful holiday season.

From Washington DC to Times Square in NYC – I’m proud to join #IAMALS to raise awareness for the need for a cure. By pushing for a cure for one neurodegenerative disease like ALS we can unlock important medical breakthroughs & change the world. https://t.co/zVcFdk1fot

We're facing unprecedented times. There is clear evidence that President Donald Trump has not honored his oath of office. I do not take this decision lightly.   Last week I announced my support for Trump's impeachment. Read more >> https://t.co/I3iQNJh0IM
In recent weeks President Trump’s actions have continued a disturbing pattern of unstable and reckless conduct towards the military >>  https://t.co/Q9qBNklkYf

Yesterday on International Day of Persons with Disabilities Congressman Langevin was honored with the Dole-Harkin Award by @USICD for his outstanding public service to the global disability community. #IDPD2019 https://t.co/xuZDBb8GZ9

As an advocate for Rhode Island’s manufacturing & defense industries Congressman Langevin applauds this historic contract that will create good jobs for Rhode Islanders & support our national security with a state-of-the-art fleet of submarines. https://t.co/XLLEosynWK

Former Ukraine ambassador's testimony during the impeachment hearing is troubling. President Donald Trump abused his power in his dealings with the Ukrainian government. Watch Jim's interview here >> https://t.co/YhFHh0oLM1 https://t.co/1kpZttHtnE https://t.co/TxEZ92AXHG

ICYMI: Congressman Jim Langevin's bill to strengthen school counseling resources is getting national attention! Read more about Jim's important legislation here: https://t.co/ZUmhuaTMSv https://t.co/TaBg1ZA6MG https://t.co/UX39TCPFJ6

Thank you to the brave members of our armed forces who served this country selflessly with honor. The decision to serve one's country is one of the most honorable decisions a person could make and I could not be more grateful for your dedication and sacrifice to this nation.

The results of Tuesday's elections showed how much enthusiasm is out there for leaders who'll fight for Democratic values at every level of government. Congratulations on big wins in Kentucky Virginia and across the country. Now on to 2020! https://t.co/M1geQ3gdou

I was proud to vote to reaffirm the U.S. government’s condemnation of the Armenian Genocide and to support the Protect Against Conflict by Turkey (PACT) Act.  Read more about my commitment to protecting our foreign relations overseas >>  https://t.co/BiyckVWKgu https://t.co/4289LI39eT

Too many students are leaving college with tens of thousands of dollars in student debt. I'm proud to work with my colleagues in the House to make college more affordable. Read more about the College Affordability Act today >>  https://t.co/0CBaccHcXz

Jim Langevin has led the effort to protect the US from cyber attacks & remains committed to strengthening our nation’s cybersecurity systems.   Let us know what you think: Should enhancing our cybersecurity be a top priority for our government? https://t.co/qem9RcBq7r https://t.co/y92dev39n0

Whether it's improving our nation's cybersecurity or the rising cost of healthcare we want to know what issues you want Congress to focus on. Take a minute to fill out our 2020 Priorities Survey to let Jim know the biggest issues facing Rhode Islanders >> https://t.co/sEFINzRHnw https://t.co/TWtrJkAlTr
“Few lawmakers in Congress today cover as much ground in cybersecurity policy as Rep. Jim Langevin (D-R.I.).” https://t.co/haB0cBxSfh

It's #NationalVoterRegistrationDay and it's never been more important to #BeAVoter and make your voice heard. Register to vote / make sure your registration is up-to-date here: https://t.co/P7X2QNOE4m https://t.co/LcPQFAdyYR
I was proud to help secure federal funding for firefighters in #WestWarwick and #Narragansett. https://t.co/vAHV8WddME
I visited Block Island last week and caught up with @BITimes to discuss a variety of issues including how we can best secure our elections. https://t.co/KywTjENLjP
We will #NeverForget the innocent lives we lost on September 11.
Enjoying lunch with my constituents on #BlockIsland @NationalHotel36 https://t.co/Lau7JpIdG5
On #LaborDay we celebrate the labor movement and honor working people in Rhode Island and across the country.
Last week I announced my support of the impeachment inquiry into President Trump's actions.  https://t.co/mV2wLYERkb
I am calling for Congress to cancel its August recess and reconvene in the wake of the latest mass shootings. https://t.co/IxmbuuBTq9

I supported a resolution to hold Attorney General Barr and Secretary Ross in contempt of Congress for refusing to provide information about the Trump Administration’s efforts to add a citizenship question to the 2020 U.S. census. https://t.co/H1ZyKcs1iM
I voted to condemn President Trump's racist attacks on U.S. Representatives Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Ilhan Omar Ayanna Pressley and Rashida Tlaib. https://t.co/nEyQc3uiA5
I was proud to vote for a bill that passed the House to extend the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund (VCF) until 2092. https://t.co/AQGO8rQLoi
My sister and brother-in-law are in town from Virginia. They’ve never had a #RI hot wiener before. We fixed that immediately at Sam’s New York System in #Warwick! https://t.co/t8LwioAvTA
Always fun to participate in the Ancient and Horribles Parade in #Chepachet! https://t.co/NyyaclNRyv
Today we celebrate the birth of our great nation and remeber how lucky we are to be Americans. Happy #4thOfJuly! https://t.co/QPCBSxyWoT
I introduced a bill in the House to help support the development of new offshore wind energy. https://t.co/P1HOXWzSrp
I was proud to secure funding for coastal waterway protection law enforcement and to improve air travel for people with disabilities.  https://t.co/m6FjFC5Xr7
Celebrated Rhode Island's #LGBTQ community in Providence last night! Great time marching in this year's @Pride_RI parade. #PrideMonth https://t.co/vpYm6mxjFG
It's no secret that Rhode Island's bridges are in poor condition. I'm working with Senator Whitehouse to fix them. https://t.co/SKeFzGoZgX
Sending my prayers and wishing a speed recovery to @DavidOrtiz. #RedSoxNation is behind you #BigPapi!
Happy #Pride2019! Excited to celebrate the #LGBTQ community and march with @pride_RI in a couple weeks.
Great evening with @SheldonforRI and the Charlestown Democrats! https://t.co/kXjEAQ2qpB
On #MemorialDay we honor the service members who made the ultimate sacrifice in defense of their fellow Americans. Thank you to all who answered the call of duty.
Great catching up with @DavidASalvatore and the @RI_REALTORS down in Washington at their reception this week! https://t.co/WUmXVlLlaw
I was joined by local state and federal officials to announce Rhode Island's new statewide cybercrime hotline.    https://t.co/ZFoWBgHmHf
It is always a privilege to be with Senator Reed at his annual breakfast! https://t.co/TXQFcqKT0k
ICYMI I joined Gene Valecenti on @NBC10 News Conference last week. https://t.co/PkVnOXLIvV
I shared some thoughts on the release of the redacted #MuellerReport yesterday. https://t.co/TUswJUHnoh
Proud to support the Stop and Shop workers who are fighting for their right to earn a decent living. https://t.co/b26epwQM9K
Had a great time at the Dancing With The Doc’s event @twinrivercasino benefiting @HopeHealthCo. Especially proud to support my friend Dr. Tony Wu. https://t.co/lfa5nCiDKG
Thrilled that the pristine rivers of the Wood-Pawcatuck Watershed in #SouthCounty have been granted this important “wild and scenic” designation! https://t.co/IFdFkqWoiN
Whether it was in law enforcement or policy-making I always knew I wanted to serve my community. https://t.co/SgXLxvobkU
Another reason why the #MuellerReport must be released. The American people have the right to see the report for themselves and draw their own conclusions. https://t.co/RRwptQ4xME
Congrats @providencecol @FriarsHockey on the big win today. Good luck at the #FrozenFour!
It's not too late to catch a great deal at a local restaurant near you this #QuahogWeek! https://t.co/dUnFJxT7hP
Good morning @egdemocrats! Sorry to miss today's pancake breakfast. Keep up the great work. 👍
Always happy to support college athletics in my district! @PCFriarsmbb @friarmanagers https://t.co/LfxIJLvla0
A summary won't suffice. The American people deserve to see the complete #MuellerReport for themselves.  https://t.co/iwJMfPgZQJ
It was great to be with my fellow #RI Democrats at the @RIDemParty State Committee meeting. https://t.co/Y3li5NCo7r
Thank you to everyone fighting for stronger gun laws at the @MFOL_RI rally this afteroon. We need comprehensive gun reform now! #MarchForOurLives #NeverAgain
Great to see @stephen_ucci and several other friends tonight in #Cranston! https://t.co/HbKKadswbk
The President's continued attacks on Senator John McCain are beyond disgraceful. Shame on you Mr. President. https://t.co/qK5E3hk8pH

I first began working to protect the rivers of the Wood-Pawcatuck watershed in 2010. Thrilled these protections have finally been made official thanks to the hard work of our amazing state and local partners!  https://t.co/8KCAuRXx8N
Best of luck to @RhodyMBB and @PCFriarsmbb as they compete for their respective conference tournament championships in New York! #MarchMadness
I introduced the FAST Voting Act to protect the vote and expand access to the ballot. Our laws should enhance not discourage voter turnout.  https://t.co/1CKVa1edv0
Proud that Democrats passed #HR1. It’s time to the end culture of corruption in Washington!   https://t.co/2ZKrt9AUyt

President Trump said border apprehensions are at an all-time high. The facts say otherwise. Disappointed Secretary Nielsen refused to set the record straight at yesterday's hearing. https://t.co/LOIixJEBUa
As a Senior Whip I will be able to shape the legislative agenda and serve as a strong voice for Rhode Islanders in the House Democratic Caucus.  https://t.co/9XMOJHGYjS
This week I voted for legislation to require universal background checks on gun sales. #EnoughIsEnough - it’s time to #EndGunViolence! https://t.co/NNRlZSxbnd
We must put people over profits. #MedicareforAll will provide quality affordable health care for all Americans! https://t.co/JwMXmDNqet
Proud to join my fellow House Democrats on this effort. We must stop the President's #FAKENationalEmergency. https://t.co/nM0NPAqE5g

The President cannot simply ignore the U.S. Constitution. His #FAKENationalEmergency declaration is an unlawful attempt at executive overreach that will only undermine our national security.   https://t.co/9jopppOSGX

With the #TrumpShutdown (hopefully) behind us I’m excited to get to work to on advancing policies that matter to #RIers like lowering the cost of health care addressing the threat of #climatechange and stopping the gun violence epidemic. https://t.co/rQff59RTuN
The rest of the county is finally realizing what we have known here in #RI for quite some time.  Providence is a one-of-a-kind destination!  https://t.co/CltmthWGIp
Black history is American history. Check out the events happening in Rhode Island to commemorate #BlackHistoryMonth. https://t.co/LRPUMGnhcN
Getting ready to watch the big game. Let's go @Patriots!  #SBLIII
In this polarized political environment the words of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. are as important as ever. #MLK90
